post_text:
*UPDATE on the Simple Valley Creations, LLC Fundraiser.

We held off for as long as we could hoping that this wonderful opportunity could be carried out. Unfortunately, we are going to have to postpone this fundraiser until next school year.

The school board & Principal have made a final decision due to the Governor's Safer At Home order.

Please continue to support your local businesses at this time. We will continue our efforts to raise funds for your children, staff & school. Please pass this information along, as emails may not be sent by administration.

Thank you all for your continued support.

post_text:
RAPT will be Kicking off another fundraiser tomorrow in collaboration with Simple Valley Creations, LLC, to raise additional funds for Year-End projects. Watch for the order forms to come home with your child on March 4th.

This is also a great time to purchase items for Mother's Day, a special someone gift or keep for yourself as Spring approaches and we begin to go outdoors more often!

Details listed on the Yellow page. Please pass this information on to anyone who may not get emails or Facebook. Anyone may order or contribute to our fundraiser.

Thank you All for the support!

post_text:
RAPT has recently donated money to help the Riverview Green Team achieve their goal towards helping the school become more environmentally friendly. Their first purchase towards that goal, is to buy a set of hand dryers to replace paper towel outside of the gym area.

This will benefit all who use the facility for a variety of eco-friendly reasons. They are still in need of funding!

To learn more, contact: Laura Grunwald, Team Leader at Lgrunwald@plymouth.k12.wi.us (pictured on the left), Tanya Cudworth, RAPT President (pictured on the right).

post_text:
Thank you to ALL who purchased from our recent fundraising event. Students & staff are celebrating their successes with great appreciation! Orders may be picked up at the school this THURSDAY between 2:30pm and 5:30pm in the Cafeteria.

All online orders not picked up, will be directly shipped to you. If you need to make special arrangements, please contact us in advance or call Tanya Cudworth @ 920-207-3044.

***We have limited storage space for frozen items, so please have those items picked up Thursday evening!

We look forward to seeing you soon.

Welcome back to school everyone! We are pleased to announce our first meeting is Thursday September 12th at 6pm in the Riverview Library. We will be discussing our budget, plans for the year and upcoming fundraisers. Mettings usually run about an hour or less. Light snacks will be provided.

Everyone is welcome. Hope to see you there!

post_text: Don't forget your donations for the Osterberg family. We are looking for cash, Walmart gift cards or gas cards. If unable to attend tonight please get on contact with Stacy Limberg if you want to donate. Thank you in advance for your help.

post_text: We are looking for your help. The family of Sariya Osterberg, a fellow 8th grader, is going thru a major medical ordeal. This is causing things to be very difficult for them. We as fellow parents and friends at Riverview would like to help them thru this difficult time. We will have donation boxes set up at the 8th grade celebration. We are looking for cash donations, Walmart gift cards, or gas cards to help them along. Please consider helping us help them. If you cannot get them there on Wednesday night please contact me at 920-838-3346 or message me here on Facebook. Please spread the word to others that might not be on here. Thank you in advance for any donations.

Thank you in advance for any donations.

post_text: Staff Appreciation day 2 meal was prepared by students from culinary classes with the assistance of Tanya Cudworth. The dish was "Blueberry Pumpkin Baked French Toast" & we added two other fruits for a variety. The recipe came from Jessica Mella, and is featured in one of her Take N Bake classes at the High School. A great time was had by all!

All wonderful products, made in the USA, a great percentage in Wisconsin!

Our next RAPT meeting is scheduled for Thursday April 25th at 5 PM in the Riverview Library. We will be planning for our upcoming Staff Appreciation week & will have a special visit from a new vendor that we will be partnering with for the 2019/2020 school year!

Let me know if you can attend so I can get a head count for a special gift. Also, please bring your ideas for next year's fundraising events. We have a big budget to fulfill & it truly takes a whole community's involvement to be successful in raising the funds!

We are very grateful for everyone who has shown support this far.

Everyone is encouraged to attend.

post_text:
SUPPORT, SHOP & SHARE!

Our Cherrydale Fundraiser will be kicking off on November 15th.This has always been a successful event for us & we are looking forward to another great TEAM effort. Students will be bringing home packets of information to raise funds for our school. Students can earn Awesome prizes! Sell 50 items and your family can earn a $200 shopping spree!

Funds raised will help provide resources not funded through our school budget! Please consider purchasing an item or two and sharing the link with friends, family & co-workers. It's easy to participate or shop online! Simply click on the link. Register your student or make your purchase by entering the group code.
www.cherrydale.com/FRRIVPW
Group code: FRRIVPW

Start date: November 15th
Packet turn in date: November 26th
Delivery date: December 11th (Riverview Gym, 2:30pm-5:00pm or shipped directly to you, if you purchase online)

Thank you all for your continued support,

RAPT Staff

post_text:
I always say to myself, "Don't turn on PBS after 10:00 pm."
Why? Because I know I am going to get sucked into watching something amazing, and that I will now be awake until at least 11:30 when the program is over. This particular Independent Lens film will hit very close to home for people than I would like to imagine. It is heartbreaking. It will make you squirm -- and that my friends is a GOOD THING!!

I encourage you to watch the film -- available by clicking on this link until November 12.

For all the young people who are Facebook friends of mine -- where do you fit into this film? You either have been bullied, have watched someone bulled, have been or are a bully. If this show makes you uncomfortable, what are you willing to do about it? Are you willing to tell someone you have been bullied, are you willing to tell someone to stop bullying someone else, or are you willing to stop being a bully?

Students, parents and educators, utilize the resources from "THE BULLY PROJECT" website. Make a change.
shared_text:
VIDEO.PBS.ORG
Watch now: Independent Lens | Bully | PBS Video

post_text:
2014 AUTHORS FESTIVAL
On Saturday, February 8, 2014 Riverview RAPT will sponsor a bus load of students and chaperones down to the Milwaukee Center for a morning of reading and writing fun!

Students will have the opportunity to attend workshops with renowned writers Jacqueline Woodson, Bryan Collier, Alan Lawrence Sitomer and Gene Luen Yang. After a continental breakfast and a welcome session students will jump into the world of writing, illustrating and reading. The morning wraps up with an autograph session.

If interested in attending, please complete the special registration form below and return it along with payment ($10) to the Riverview office before December 1. If you have any questions please contact Mrs. Kelly Haefs (kellyhaefs@gmail.com) or Mrs. Graening (lgraening@plymouth.k12.wi.us)

Registration Form: http://www.plymouth.k12.wi.us/images/friday/131201authorfest.pdf
Author's Fest Brochure: http://www.plymouth.k12.wi.us/images/friday/131201authorbrochure.pdf

post_text:
Another excerpt from "The Revealers" by Doug Wilhelm:

"Bethany DeMere is the ruler of the top clique of the seventh-grade girls. She's popular, and she's one of those people who knows just what to say to cut you down. A lot of times she doesn't say anything--she just looks away and shakes her head so her hair ripples down her back. She has this long wavy blond hair that she know is pretty eye-catching. If she wants to show you that you are not worth seeing or hearing, she shakes her hair as she turns away and sighs or rolls her eyes at somebody who IS worth seeing and hearing." (p.28)
text:
Another excerpt from "The Revealers" by Doug Wilhelm:

"Bethany DeMere is the ruler of the top clique of the seventh-grade girls. She's popular, and she's one of those people who knows just what to say to cut you down. A lot of times she doesn't say anything--she just looks away and shakes her head so her hair ripples down her back. She has this long wavy blond hair that she know is pretty eye-catching. If she wants to show you that you are not worth seeing or hearing, she shakes her hair as she turns away and sighs or rolls her eyes at somebody who IS worth seeing and hearing." (p.28)

post_text:
Here is an excerpt from Riverview's One Book, One School event "The Revealers" by Doug Wihelm:

"Middle school, at least our middle school, was basically a place you tried to survive. Last year in sixth grade, when it started, I still had lots of friends from elementary school--but it was like we had all gone from a family sort of place to this big, dim noisy train station. Everybody was rushing around and you hardly knew anybody, and there were predators. They were all over, the predators. Even some of the kids you knew starting turning into them. Plus, a lot of kids at our school were changing and making these tight little cliques, and if you didn't fit in somewhere you could be in trouble. One by one, my friends went pfft. (p.9)

Go to the OBOS website and see the activities our kids did yesterday!

http://riverviewobos.weebly.com/oct-8.html

RIVERVIEWOBOS.WEEBLY.COM
